content: I'm getting back into IG creation a bit and watching the excellent recording from the september workshop at https://www.youtube.com/user/HealthLevelSevenInc/playlists (great stuff here). Can anyone point me to the slides for these sessions?

BTW, it seems to me like some of the content at https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/IG+Publisher+Documentation is a bit stale...should I just edit it as I want...or better to click the "Provide feedback" link and let someone else do the edits?
for example, would be cool if https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/IG+Publisher+Documentation#IGPublisherDocumentation-Examples pointed at that nice https://github.com/FHIR/sample-ig project
if it's really obvious you can just fix it
but good to discuss anything not totally obvious here
cool. i can add the link to this new sample. i think the existing references there are stale and so i'll remove those

If you want an example of IG source, you can look in one of the following places:
* FHIR GitHub repository, in /guides/* - any directory ending in 2 - a variety of styles of implementation guide.
* Also, there's /tests/ig which is used for testing the tooling

[10:36:54] lmsurpre@lees-mbp-2 ~/git/hl7-fhir on master
$ ls guides/
ehrsrle
$ ls tests/ig
ls: tests/ig: No such file or directory
exit 1
The correct solution is probably to put the "correct" documentation on Confluence and update the wiki page to say it's deprecated and point to the Confluence page
